security: Revealing operational details, such as AMWEE-1 caching and making dead drops while under DSE surveillance, could compromise ongoing intelligence activities and expose sources. Quoting directly: "PLEASE BRIEF DAIBOLD ON WAVE'S VIEWS RE (AMWEE-1) CACHING AND MAKING DEAD DROPS AT THIS TIME IN LIGHT 7. ASSUME (AMWEE-1) UNDER DSE SURVEILLANCE, PARTICULARLY SINCE EXFILTRATION AMWEE-2 AND ANTAURA-147 KEYWAY DEEPLY CONCERNED (CONTINUE) for caching AND MAKING HERS rose ENT CIRCUMS"
summary: A JMWAVE cable discusses the feasibility of AMWEE-1 caching and making dead drops, considering AMWEE-1's potential surveillance and the concerns of AMWEE-2 and ANTAURA-147.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET cable from JMWAVE, dated December 10, requests an immediate briefing for DAIBOLD on WAVE's perspective regarding AMWEE-1's caching and dead drop activities. It expresses concern about AMWEE-1 potentially being under DSE surveillance, particularly given the unease of AMWEE-2 and ANTAURA-147 regarding these actions. The cable references previous communications (WAVE 8316, WAVE 8346, DIR 87628, DIR 97290, DIR 87508, WAVE 8762) and ends with a brief sign-off from HALOVEY of C/SAS/MOB.
title: RYBAT TYPIC AMWER AMPAUNA
